GuardObserver.synopsis: Guard is watching operations at Moonrise Docks. If the other guard jumped into the water, the player can use it to send this last guard away so they can examine the cargo.

Vat.synopsis: The player has investigated the vat, showing thousands of tadpoles. They are being used to bolster their number of soldiers for their attack on Baldurs Gate. The player can destroy the Vat, depriving some of their numbers, or utter a phrase to influence whoever these tadpoles end up attached to.
Vat.how_to_trigger: Click on the tadpole vat when no guards are near by.

AD_ObserverWitness.synopsis: The guard just witnessed a guard jump into the water.
AD_ObserverWitness.how_to_trigger: Talk to the dock jumperDig into his mindTell him to "wash them off"Dock Observer will AD if he sees it (so distracting him will skip this)

PAD_Vat.synopsis: The vats on the Moonrise Tower docks are full of tadpoles.
PAD_Vat.how_to_trigger: Interact with a vat on the Moonrise Tower docks.

AD_Patroller001Witness.synopsis: DockPatroller_001 witness DockJumper jump into the water.
AD_Patroller001Witness.how_to_trigger: Use true soul powers to convince the DockJumper to jump into the water while within view of the other guards.

GuardJumper.synopsis: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock. The crates contain tadpoles, intended to infect the citizens of Baldur's Gate. The guard doesn't know this, and if we force the knowledge on him his mind breaks.

AD_JumperGreeting.synopsis: Acolyte Marls, who stands guard of the cargo at the docks, greets the player as they first pass by the docks at Moonrise.

AD_ObserverFishing.synopsis: The Dock Guard Observer is standing peering over the dock where one of his subordinates just jumped into the water for apparently no reason. All lines are low grumbling, as if spoken to the dead man.
AD_ObserverFishing.how_to_trigger: Go to Moonrise Docks -90; 5; -187Talk to the Dock Guard JumperUse Tadpole power to have him jump into the waterTalk to the Dock Guard Observer and tell him the other guard jumpedFollow the Observer into and out of the tower (it's controlled by anubis, so his movement does not update if he is not loaded)Observe him looking over the dock edge.

AD_Patroller000Witness.synopsis: DockPatroller_000 witness DockJumper jumping into the water.
AD_Patroller000Witness.how_to_trigger: Use true soul powers to convince the DockJumper to jump into the water while within view of the other guards.

GuardPatroller001.synopsis: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock.

AD_ObserverInspect.synopsis: The dock observer has seen that the Vat he was in charge of was destroyed. He articulates this disappointment.
AD_ObserverInspect.how_to_trigger: Go to the docks -90; 5; -187Destroy the Vat without trigger crime (can debug kill the vat)Triggers after he sees the destroyed Vat (an invisible helper that moves to the location the vat is destroyed)

Checkpoint.synopsis: The guard mindmelds with player, senses their tadpole, and gladly lets them into the towers, telling them to report to Disciple Z'rell (Zuh-rELL).

GuardPatroller000.synopsis: An Absolute guard protecting crates at the dock.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: Several sessions imply cause‐and‐effect relations. First, several events revolve around the behavior of the guard designated as the Jumper. The Jumper must first be induced (via use of true soul powers) to jump from his post. Only after GuardJumper has jumped can witnesses (AD_ObserverWitness, AD_Patroller001Witness, and AD_Patroller000Witness) observe the event. In addition, one session (GuardObserver) describes the guard noticing that a guard jumped – an observation that logically requires a witness event (here taken as AD_ObserverWitness) to have occurred first. AD_ObserverFishing, which involves the observer commenting on the incident, also presupposes that the Jumper’s action (and thus witnessing) has already taken place. In a separate chain of events, the Vat session involves the player investigating a vat of tadpoles – and one option is to destroy it. If the Vat is destroyed, then AD_ObserverInspect is triggered when the observer notes the vat’s destruction. Finally, since there are two sessions related to vats – one detailed as Vat (triggered under the condition that no guards are nearby, allowing for destruction or other actions) and another PAD_Vat (when interacting with a vat on the Moonrise Tower docks) – it is reasonable to assume they represent alternative interactions with the same object. Therefore they should be considered mutually exclusive in a given playthrough.

GuardObserver_2.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_2.text: I see Marls took... took a bit of a dive.

GuardObserver_28.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_28.text: Good riddance. He deserved it! ... whatever he did.
GuardObserver_28.context: NodeContext: Vehemently on our side - he does not want to piss us off like his ill-fated friend did. Last line a little uncertain.

GuardObserver_38.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_38.text: Are you much of a swimmer?

GuardObserver_26.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_26.text: No, True Soul. Not I. Too busy doing my job. Which... I'll get back to, aye?

GuardObserver_1.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_1.text: He tried to stop me from inspecting the cargo.

GuardObserver_12.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_12.text: Fool. He always took orders too literally. Of course you can check the cargo.
GuardObserver_12.context: NodeContext: A little too quickly, sucking up to us.

GuardObserver_18.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_18.text: I showed him the truth of the tadpoles you're shipping.

GuardObserver_8.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_8.text: Tell me why you're shipping tadpoles to the city.

GuardObserver_40.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_40.text: ...Tadpoles? Like... a delicacy? I wouldn't know much about that, True Soul.

GuardObserver_37.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_37.text: I'm just a soldier. Which, speaking of... I'd best go report my man missing. If you'll excuse me...

GuardObserver_14.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_14.text: Your soldier abandoned his post. You'd best go report it.

GuardObserver_13.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_13.text: We're not supposed to leave the cargo un-... oh.
GuardObserver_13.context: NodeContext: Trailing off as he realizes this is what got his comrade killed

GuardObserver_4.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_4.text: Of course, True Soul! As you say.
GuardObserver_4.context: NodeContext: Overeager, nervous to please us

GuardObserver_7.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_7.text: He was from the city, I think. Well... down there's his home now.

GuardObserver_21.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_21.text: Tell me why you're shipping tadpoles to the city.

GuardObserver_22.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_22.text: Ah, sorry True Soul. Cargo's been tampered with - I'd best see to it.

GuardObserver_25.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_25.text: Beg pardon, True Soul - but you're distracting me.

GuardObserver_15.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_15.text: Just doing my job. They say the Absolute sees our work, and elevates the worthy.

GuardObserver_30.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_30.text: What's so important about these boxes?

GuardObserver_5.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_5.text: They're not to be opened until they reach the city. The Absolute smiles on them that follow orders.

GuardObserver_29.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_29.text: And I don't plan on being a guard for long, True Soul.

GuardObserver_6.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_6.text: I see. Then you'd better fish your man out of the lake.

GuardObserver_34.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_34.text: What? Beshaba's black bones - wait here. I'll find something to drag him out.

GuardObserver_36.speaker: Zealot Arden
GuardObserver_36.text: Not letting a decent suit of armour rot down there on my watch.

GuardObserver_23.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_23.text: You definitely have the attitude of a True Soul, at least.

GuardObserver_35.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_35.text: Tell me why you're shipping tadpoles to the city.

GuardObserver_3.speaker: Player
GuardObserver_3.text: Just letting you know that your soldier's taken a dive into the lake.

Vat_26.speaker: Narrator
Vat_26.text: *Your tadpole squirms and shrinks away - inside the vat is a churning mass you can do nothing to quell.*

Vat_28.speaker: Narrator
Vat_28.text: *A wave of sick familiarity radiates from one barrel amidst the cargo.*

Vat_29.speaker: Narrator
Vat_29.text: *Tadpoles. Sleeping and scarcely aware, but echoing yours a hundredfold.*

Vat_45.speaker: Lae'zel
Vat_45.text: An army's worth of slithering parasites. Sickness, waiting to spread.

Vat_16.speaker: Shadowheart
Vat_16.text: Look at them all... enough to infect an entire army.

Vat_2.speaker: Karlach
Vat_2.text: Look at all those tads. Enough to make an army of Absolutists.

Vat_24.speaker: Narrator
Vat_24.text: *A pattern of blank minds, newly born. They carry only a bare shred of memory, inherited from something older.*
Vat_24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player Mindmelding and sees a vision of the tadpoles squirming

Vat_38.speaker: Narrator
Vat_38.text: *A sleep of centuries, the birth and destruction of a settlement above forming only background noise to the dream.*
Vat_38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Continuing vision of the tadpoles

Vat_43.speaker: Narrator
Vat_43.text: *Until something descended down into the darkness... and the dreamer awoke.*
Vat_43.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player, perturbed as mind-meld aura abruptly disappears

Vat_12.speaker: Lae'zel
Vat_12.text: Empty. Void of essence, void of purpose. We cannot allow their birth.

Vat_36.speaker: Astarion
Vat_36.text: They don't know what they are - not yet. Unless we taught them to be something else...

Vat_25.speaker: Gale
Vat_25.text: These tadpoles come from an ancient colony down below the tower. Whatever we do with them, we must deny their use to the Absolute.

Vat_23.speaker: Shadowheart
Vat_23.text: These tadpoles came from beneath the tower. If we use them, we'll deny the cultists of their power.

Vat_19.speaker: Wyll
Vat_19.text: They came from below. We could destroy them, or perhaps...

Vat_7.speaker: Wyll
Vat_7.text: No. Annihilation is the only option.

Vat_9.speaker: Karlach
Vat_9.text: It's not too late to stop the cult from using these things. Now's our chance to change them - or fry 'em.

Vat_4.speaker: Narrator
Vat_4.text: *A mental churning as your interference stokes the tadpoles into a boiling frenzy. The connection snaps.*

Vat_47.speaker: Player
Vat_47.text: Examine the seal - it looks familiar to you.

Vat_10.speaker: Narrator
Vat_10.text: *No ledger or shipping manifest presents itself - but there is a seal stamped on the lid.*

Vat_34.speaker: Narrator
Vat_34.text: *The winged serpent of the Zhentarim. These must be the 'goods' that Roah agreed to move into the city.*

Vat_17.speaker: Narrator
Vat_17.text: *The winged serpent of the Zhentarim. It seems their pursuit of profit extends even here.*

Vat_14.speaker: Narrator
Vat_14.text: *The winged serpent of the Zhentarim - a network of merchant and mercenaries, known for their deep pockets and shallow scruples.*

Vat_3.speaker: Narrator
Vat_3.text: *There is no ledger to hint at a destination. Only a seal stamped on the lid, unknown to you.*

Vat_42.speaker: Astarion
Vat_42.text: There's so many. Enough for an army of mindless slaves.
Vat_42.context: NodeContext: Looking at a vat full of mind flayer tadpoles

Vat_32.speaker: Wyll
Vat_32.text: Holy hells. Each one, a mind flayer in waiting.

Vat_22.speaker: Gale
Vat_22.text: Burn them, I say. Burn them all.

Vat_35.speaker: Narrator
Vat_35.text: *The vat is still, placid - thousands of tadpoles happily awaiting their hosts.*

Vat_48.speaker: Narrator
Vat_48.text: *Your tadpole squirms, and feels a legion of echoes in response.*

AD_ObserverWitness_0.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverWitness_0.text: Just... move on, Arden. You didn't see anything.
AD_ObserverWitness_0.context: NodeContext: said to himself - he's just watched one of his comrades comically executed, not for the first time. Keeping his head down.

PAD_Vat_1.speaker: Player
PAD_Vat_1.text: Are these... parasites? There must be hundreds!

PAD_Vat_2.speaker: Player
PAD_Vat_2.text: Whatever the cult is planning - it's nothing good.

PAD_Vat_0.speaker: Player
PAD_Vat_0.text: Be a shame if these never made it onto the ship...

AD_Minthara_AtDocks_0.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
AD_Minthara_AtDocks_0.text: Shipments of parasites, bound for Baldur's Gate. Half the city may be infected already.

GuardJumper_29.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_29.text: Worms. Do you feel them? Feel them crawling?
GuardJumper_29.context: NodeContext: Breathy, panicked - you've broken his mind a little

GuardJumper_32.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_32.text: Not long before they march on the city.

GuardJumper_35.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_35.text: I'm afraid you missed the ship, True Soul.
GuardJumper_35.context: NodeContext: Friendly - speaking to an equal (he believes)

GuardJumper_51.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_51.text: But there'll be another along soon enough. We're already stacking the cargo.
GuardJumper_51.context: CinematicNodeContext: gestures nondescriptly at nearby crates

GuardJumper_76.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_76.text: Baldur's Gate. The army marches overland, but we've sent some friends ahead to smooth the way.

GuardJumper_45.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_45.text: Why does the Absolute want to make war with the city?

GuardJumper_33.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_33.text: Locals need to see Her truth - take their place in Her design.

GuardJumper_63.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_63.text: Or they don't, and we send them to meet the old gods they cling to. Doesn't matter much either way.

GuardJumper_34.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_34.text: Your friends are bringing unusual cargo with them.

GuardJumper_77.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_77.text: Nothing of note. Just supplies for the battle ahead - I've already checked it twice over.

GuardJumper_13.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_13.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

GuardJumper_65.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_65.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*
GuardJumper_65.context: InternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to a companion.

GuardJumper_70.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_70.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

GuardJumper_50.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_50.text: Your job is to guard. Leave the details to me, yes?

GuardJumper_41.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_41.text: The cargo's important. Another look can't do any harm.

GuardJumper_10.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_10.text: Eh... right you are, I suppose. Check away.
GuardJumper_10.context: NodeContext: Hesitantly. Doesn't see the sense in our double-checking his work, but we're throwing our weight around and he's letting us.

GuardJumper_57.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_57.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

GuardJumper_79.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_79.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

GuardJumper_20.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_20.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

GuardJumper_15.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_15.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

GuardJumper_83.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_83.text: *As you bear down on his mind, you feel a pulse in response. A thousand pulses, echoing from the nearby crates.*

GuardJumper_5.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_5.text: *Tadpoles. His mind had rejected the knowledge, forced it behind a mental wall. A wall you just took a hammer to.*

GuardJumper_30.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_30.text: W-worms. Worms in their heads. Worms all over!
GuardJumper_30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Wide-eyed, repeating over and overNodeContext: Breathless, near-catatonic with shock

GuardJumper_28.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_28.text: You had best wash them off.

GuardJumper_46.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: He holds his head in panic, then after dialogue leaps into the water and vanishes from sightNodeContext: Breathy, panicked - you've broken his mind a little

GuardJumper_12.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_12.text: Guard duty's boring. You're letting your imagination run away with you.

GuardJumper_52.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_52.text: *And as quickly as you tore down his defences, you shore them back up. His mind is blank, and blissfully ignorant once more.*

GuardJumper_84.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_84.text: ...Hm? Oh, True Soul. You just missed the ship - but there'll be another one along soon.

GuardJumper_74.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_74.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

GuardJumper_81.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_81.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

GuardJumper_37.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_37.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

GuardJumper_47.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_47.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

GuardJumper_26.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_26.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

GuardJumper_64.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_64.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

GuardJumper_22.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_22.text: It's just food. Supplies. Like I said.

GuardJumper_21.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_21.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

GuardJumper_44.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_44.text: *A strange sensation courses through you, and your companion's mind unfolds, secrets half-revealed.*
GuardJumper_44.context: InternalNodeContext: Delete if you are talking to an NPC.

GuardJumper_56.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_56.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

GuardJumper_38.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_38.text: Then you won't mind stepping aside and letting me look.

GuardJumper_24.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_24.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

GuardJumper_80.speaker: Narrator
GuardJumper_80.text: *You focus on the source of the power, but it is quiet and still. It needs to rest.*

GuardJumper_62.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_62.text: Think hard. What's really in the boxes?

GuardJumper_55.speaker: Player
GuardJumper_55.text: I checked the cargo. It's a little unusual.

GuardJumper_60.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_60.text: Don't see how, True Soul. It's just supplies going ahead of the troops.

GuardJumper_71.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_71.text: Another along soon, True Soul. Another. Another...
GuardJumper_71.context: NodeContext: Starts out cheerfully, trails off slightly confused. Meant to be eerie - we broke his mind and then patched it back together - this phrase it all he's hanging onto

GuardJumper_75.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_75.text: Worms. Crawling under my skin. Get them off, get them off!

GuardJumper_85.speaker: Acolyte Marls
GuardJumper_85.text: I'm on duty, True Soul. Sorry.
GuardJumper_85.context: NodeContext: Stiff, awkward, a little wary of us. We're his superior but he thinks we might be a little unstable.

AD_JumperGreeting_0.speaker: Acolyte Marls
AD_JumperGreeting_0.text: Enjoy the view. Feels like it'd stretch all the way to the Sea of Swords on a clear day. If this place ever gets a clear day.

AD_ObserverFishing_0.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverFishing_0.text: Must've found some booze among the supplies. Idiot.
AD_ObserverFishing_0.context: NodeContext: Irritated, speaking to comrade who's just jumped into the water and sank

AD_ObserverFishing_1.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverFishing_1.text: Least you could've done was strip off your gear first, fool.
AD_ObserverFishing_1.context: NodeContext: Irritated, speaking to comrade who's just jumped into the water and sank

AD_ObserverFishing_2.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverFishing_2.text: Don't think for a bloody second I'm going in there after you.
AD_ObserverFishing_2.context: NodeContext: Irritated, speaking to comrade who's just jumped into the water and sank

AD_ObserverFishing_3.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverFishing_3.text: I'd say a prayer for you, lad, but I honestly do not remember your name.
AD_ObserverFishing_3.context: NodeContext: Irritated, speaking to comrade who's just jumped into the water and sank

GuardPatroller001_0.speaker: Adept Bel
GuardPatroller001_0.context: NodeContext: Nervous of us, wants to get back to patrolling

GuardPatroller001_2.speaker: Adept Bel
GuardPatroller001_2.text: Look busy or they'll set you lifting too. And whatever's inside is heavy.

GuardPatroller001_3.speaker: Adept Bel
GuardPatroller001_3.text: Whatever Marls did, I had no part in it.
GuardPatroller001_3.context: NodeContext: A little nervous - just saw us make an example of another guard

AD_ObserverInspect_0.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_ObserverInspect_0.context: NodeContext: Ill-MAY-ter - a god of martyrdom. The curse is a bit like 'Jesus Christ', with a creative 'arsing' thrown in.

Checkpoint_12.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_12.text: Nightwarden Minthara - you were not expected here.

Checkpoint_38.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint_38.text: *Her thoughts probe your own, finding - freedom. Heresy.*

Checkpoint_37.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint_37.text: *Her thoughts invade your own, hunting for recognition. Your parasite offers it, readily.*

Checkpoint_10.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_10.text: My apologies. Welcome back, True Soul - what news?

Checkpoint_46.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_46.text: How delightful. It's you. Disciple Z'rell was looking forward to meeting the one who aided Balthazar. She was very pleased indeed to see him return with the Nightsong.

Checkpoint_21.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_21.text: How delightful. The scouts reported your victory against the Harpers, but Disciple Z'rell was looking forward to hearing about it from you in person.

Checkpoint_18.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_18.text: She's in the audience chamber. Go on in.

Checkpoint_42.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_42.text: True Soul. A pleasure. What news from the field?

Checkpoint_14.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_14.text: 'Welcome back'? I've never been here before.

Checkpoint_28.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_28.text: My mistake - your mind tasted familiar. Where are you reporting from?

Checkpoint_0.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_0.text: Grymforge - I ran into some trouble, but I handled it.

Checkpoint_33.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_33.text: Glad to hear it. Z'rell will be too. The scrying eyes only see so much.

Checkpoint_26.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_26.text: She's in the audience chamber, True Soul. Go right ahead.

Checkpoint_13.speaker: Lae'zel
Checkpoint_13.text: Our path leads to Z'rell. Let us not keep her waiting.

Checkpoint_2.speaker: Shadowheart
Checkpoint_2.text: Let's hope this Z'rell likes what we have to say.

Checkpoint_4.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_4.context: NodeContext: as a farewell - equivalent to 'god bless you'

Checkpoint_52.speaker: Karlach
Checkpoint_52.text: That's what I call an invitation. Let's find Z'rell and get this caravan moving.

Checkpoint_44.speaker: Astarion
Checkpoint_44.text: Well then, let's not keep her waiting.

Checkpoint_15.speaker: Wyll
Checkpoint_15.text: Z'rell - fancy name. Let's put our best foot forward. Or is it best feet?

Checkpoint_32.speaker: Gale
Checkpoint_32.text: If it's an audience she desires, an audience let us provide.

Checkpoint_6.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_6.text: That's for your superiors to know.

Checkpoint_47.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_47.text: Nowhere of importance. What news inside?

Checkpoint_34.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_34.text: General Ketheric's advisor went off on a field trip - Z'rell's in charge 'til he gets back.

Checkpoint_49.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_49.text: Z'rell's in the audience chamber, True Soul. Go right ahead.

Checkpoint_45.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_45.text: I infiltrated a group of Harpers at an Inn, out in the shadows.

Checkpoint_35.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_35.text: Impressive. I'm sure Z'rell will want to hear all about it.

Checkpoint_25.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_25.text: Surprise - I'm here to take your head.

Checkpoint_24.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_24.context: NodeContext: combat about to start - with that edge

Checkpoint_36.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_36.text: Did she now? You'll find her inside, though you'll want to speak to Z'rell first.

Checkpoint_55.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_55.text: I have a message from Nere. Who should I report to?

Checkpoint_3.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_3.text: Trouble in the Underdark - but I handled it.

Checkpoint_11.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_11.text: Little to report. What news inside?

Checkpoint_23.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_23.text: More importantly, why is one of our rank on guard duty?

Checkpoint_27.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_27.text: To greet those of our like, and weed out those who walk where they do not belong.

Checkpoint_9.speaker: Player
Checkpoint_9.text: I've infiltrated an encampment of Harpers protected by a cleric of Selûne.

Checkpoint_29.speaker: Zealot Krizt
Checkpoint_29.text: Where do you think you're going?

Checkpoint_30.speaker: Narrator
Checkpoint_30.text: *Her mind attempts to connect with yours and finds - nothing. You have no tadpole, and no welcome in this place.*

GuardPatroller000_0.speaker: Zealot Renan
GuardPatroller000_0.text: Hold your nose 'round the crates. Some got a little ripe down in the cellar.

GuardPatroller000_1.speaker: Zealot Renan
GuardPatroller000_1.text: Shame about Marls. But the Absolute breaks those that don't truly believe, I suppose.
GuardPatroller000_1.context: NodeContext: Reflecting on a fellow guard who just went mad and jumped into the water nearby. She's seen it happen before - people of your rank weeding out non-believers

GuardPatroller000_2.speaker: Zealot Renan
GuardPatroller000_2.text: Feel free to haul a few boxes. We need all the hands we can get.

GuardPatroller000_3.speaker: Zealot Renan
GuardPatroller000_3.text: You won't find my faith lacking, True Soul. I'll do anything for Her.
GuardPatroller000_3.context: NodeContext: Reaffirming that we won't need to discipline her like we did her colleague. The 'Her' she refers to is the Absolute.
